description.value:
Trigger Two or more creatures enter the area

Effect A spiraling column of spirits gather, becoming a whirling cyclone of souls @Template[type:burst|distance:5]{10 feet wide} and 60 feet tall. The haunt then rolls initiative.

details.description: A cyclone of angry spirits surges around the area.
details.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:30] (trained) or @Check[type:religion|dc:30] (trained) to weaken the haunt; three total successes in any combination are required to disable the haunt
details.reset: The spirit cyclone disperses after 1 minute and resets after 1 day.
details.routine: (3 actions) The spirit cyclone uses 3 actions to move, traveling up to 30 feet with each action and dealing [[/r (2d10+13)[negative]]] damage to each creature in its path (@Check[type:reflex|dc:32|basic:true] save). A creature needs to attempt only one save during the cyclone's movement, even if the cyclone moves over its space more than once. On a critical failure, a creature is swept up into the cyclone, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Grabbed] (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Escape] DC 32). A creature grabbed by the cyclone moves along with the cyclone and takes [[/r (1d10+6)[negative]]] damage at their beginning of its turn, and it must attempt a Reflex save against the cyclone on the cyclone's turn, no matter where the cyclone moves. A creature that successfully Escapes from the cyclone falls from a height of [[/r {1d12*5} #Falling Distance]]{1d12 x 5 feet}.
